Mark E. Meade, PE, PLS, CP Photo Science, Inc.

page.title:
Why Digital Imagery?
Why Digital Imagery?
page.enlisting:
• Eliminates film, lab processing, digital scanning • Highest quality imagery available today – Very high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) • 12-bit data results in stunning imagery – 4096 values versus 256 in 8-bit imagery • No artifacts to deal with… lint, dust, scratches • Very stable geometry, first generation imagery • Simultaneous collection of pan, color, and IR • Eliminates film, lab processing, digital scanning • Highest quality imagery available today – Very high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR)
• Eliminates film, lab processing, digital scanning • E l i m i n a t e s

Digital Cameras
Digital Cameras

page.title:
Digital Camera versus Film
Digital Camera versus Film
page.enlisting:
• Advantages – B&W, color, and infrared in a single pass. – No need for film, processing, other lab products. – Scanning not required. – Imagery free from lint, dust, scratches. – Production of imagery can start on the same day of flight. – Better spectral resolution than film cameras. • Disadvantages – Calibration somewhat of an issue – Data storage from capture until production! • Advantages
• Advantages • A d v a n t a g e s
– B&W, color, and infrared in a single pass. – No need for film, processing, other lab products. – Scanning not required. – Imagery free from lint, dust, scratches. – Production of imagery can start on the same day of flight. – Better spectral resolution than film cameras.

page.title:
Traditional Film Approach
Traditional Film Approach

Film Approach
Film Approach
page.enlisting:
Advantages • Many film cameras owned by mapping firms • Most have FMC capabilities • Relatively inexpensive ($100k to $500k) • Strong geometry for mapping applications Disadvantages • Must scan analog film to get to digital environment • Film grain, dust, lint, hairs evident in imagery
Advantages

page.title:
Pushbroom Sensor (Leica ADS 40)
Pushbroom Sensor (Leica ADS 40)

Pushbroom Digital Approach
Pushbroom Digital Approach
page.enlisting:
Advantages • High quality digital imagery (1’ and less resolution) • Medium cost digital platform ($1M) • Simultaneous capture of pan, color, and IR • Productive for creation of digital orthophotos • Does not require mosaic lines in the direction of flight Disadvantages • Weaker mapping geometry than both film and DMC • Aerotriangulation solution less rigorous • More difficult to create stereopairs for compilation
Advantages
• High quality digital imagery (1’ and less resolution)
• Medium cost digital platform ($1M) • M e d i u m

page.title:
Framing Sensor (Z/I DMC)
Framing Sensor (Z/I DMC)

DMC Approach
DMC Approach
page.enlisting:
Advantages • Highest quality digital imagery available today • FMC included on all cameras • Very strong geometry for mapping • Ideal for AT, easy to create stereopairs for compilation • Capable of very high image resolution (to 0.10 feet) • Simultaneous capture of pan, color, and IR Disadvantages • Most expensive hardware available ($1.8M) • Requires ortho mosaic lines in the direction of flight
Advantages
